decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on generating early board presence and applying pressure quickly with efficient creatures. It utilizes Eldrazi Skyspawner and Lambholt Pacifist to establish a strong board presence, while Reflector Mage and Sylvan Advocate help control the opponent's board. Collected Company allows for explosive plays and card advantage, with Archangel Avacyn providing a powerful threat and protection. The deck also includes some disruption with Dromoka's Command and Declaration in Stone, as well as additional value cards like Tireless Tracker and Nissa, Vastwood Seer.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures to apply pressure on the opponent while utilizing disruptive elements to control the board. Eldrazi Skyspawner and Dimensional Infiltrator provide early threats, while Eldrazi Displacer and Reflector Mage disrupt the opponent's strategy. Collected Company helps to fill the board with creatures and Den Protector provides recursion. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar offers additional threats and buffing capabilities. Stratus Dancer and Ojutai's Command provide flexibility in countering spells and gaining card advantage. The mana base ensures consistent access to all necessary colors for the deck's strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to swarm the battlefield with aggressive Eldrazi creatures and support cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With high-power creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, backed up by removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Spatial Contortion, the deck aims to deal damage early and efficiently. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional support and can create an army of tokens, while cards like Eldrazi Displacer and Hedron Crawler help with mana acceleration and creature manipulation. The deck also has some land utility with Rogue's Passage and Westvale Abbey.

This deck focuses on generating tokens, sacrificing them for value, and draining the opponent's life total with Zulaport Cutthroat. By using cards like Nantuko Husk and Eldrazi Displacer, you can create a loop of sacrificing creatures and draining your opponent for significant damage. The deck also utilizes cards like Collected Company and Cryptolith Rite to maximize your board presence and generate more value from your creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and drain them out before they can mount a defense.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to flood the board with creatures and generate value through sacrificing them. It utilizes cards like Cryptolith Rite and Collected Company to accelerate mana production and find key creatures quickly. The deck also includes cards like Nantuko Husk and Zulaport Cutthroat to take advantage of sacrificing creatures for additional damage and life gain. By overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures and sacrificing them to fuel powerful effects, this deck aims to quickly close out games through aggressive tactics and efficient synergy.

This deck aims to aggressively establish board presence with efficient creatures like Tireless Tracker and Sylvan Advocate, while also utilizing removal spells such as Stasis Snare and Silkwrap to control the opponent's board. The planeswalkers, Nahiri, the Harbinger and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, provide additional threats and card advantage. Dragonlord Atarka and Archangel Avacyn offer powerful finishers to close out the game. The deck also includes some versatile spells like Oath of Nissa and Radiant Flames to adapt to different board states. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to all colors needed.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and powerful planeswalkers, while also using creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Tireless Tracker to pressure the opponent. The mana base allows for easy access to all colors needed for the spells and planeswalkers in the deck. The combination of removal, creatures, and planeswalkers provides a versatile game plan that can adapt to different matchups and situations, ultimately leading to victory through resource management and strategic decisions.

The main idea of this deck is to gain control of the game through efficient removal spells and board wipes, while also generating advantage through card draw effects. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with hand disruption spells like Transgress the Mind and removal spells like Grasp of Darkness and Anguished Unmaking. The win condition of the deck is to either overwhelm the opponent with token creatures from Secure the Wastes or Westvale Abbey, or to close out the game with powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Grim Nemesis and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar.

The main focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantages through card advantage and utility lands. The deck utilizes a mixture of removal spells, board wipes, hand disruption, and card draw to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Gideon, and Ob Nixilis, the deck can generate threats while also providing additional control options. The deck aims to grind out the opponent and eventually overpower them with its versatile suite of control tools.

The main theme of this deck focuses on quickly and aggressively playing creatures and planeswalkers to swarm the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent. By using cards like Archangel Avacyn, Hangarback Walker, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, the deck aims to establish board presence and put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, cards like Oath of Nissa and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar provide card advantage and support the aggro strategy by generating tokens and buffing creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency and supporting the Selesnya color pairing.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a combination of efficient creatures like Hangarback Walker and Archangel Avacyn along with powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Gideon. The deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and utilize cards like Dromoka's Command and Stasis Snare to control the board and protect its creatures. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure on the opponent and secure victory.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Hangarback Walker and Archangel Avacyn, along with pump spells like Dromoka's Command and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar, the deck aims to end the game swiftly through aggressive attacks. The deck also includes removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Stasis Snare to deal with opposing threats, while cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional ways to boost the team's power and resilience.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm and agressively attack the opponent with a swarm of low-cost, efficient white creatures. By utilizing cards that buff and enhance multiple creatures at once, as well as removal spells to clear the opponent's board, this deck aims to maintain a constant pressure and tempo advantage. With a strong early game presence and the ability to quickly build a wide board state, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize and mount a defense.
